Description: THE GLEN CANYON DAM ADAPTIVE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM (GCDAMP) SERVES THE PUBLIC PURPOSE OF ASSISTING THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT BY PROVIDING INFORMATION WHICH HELPS TO MAKE OPERATIONAL MANAGEMENT DECISIONS OF THE GLEN CANYON DAM, TO AID IN THE PRESERVING THE NATURAL RESOURCES OF THE GLEN CANYON AND GRAND CANYON. THESE NATURAL RESOURCES COMPRISE A SERIES OF ITEMS THAT HAVE SIGNIFICANT IMPACT TO TRIBAL MEMBERS BELONGING TO THE TRIBAL RESERVATIONS WHICH ARE ADJACENT TO THE COLORADO RIVER. THESE ITEMS INCLUDE TRIBAL CULTURAL AND RELIGIOUS PLACES, CEREMONIAL LOCATIONS, PLANTS AND ANIMALS, AND TRIBAL HISTORY. DIRECT RECIPIENTS OF THIS GRANT WILL INCLUDE ALL ASSOCIATED TRIBAL MEMBERS, EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS UTILIZING GCDAMP PUBLICATIONS, AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC UTILIZING THE AREAS FOR RECREATION.I. PARTICIPATIONII. MONITORING PROGRAMS III. CULTURAL SENSITIVITY TRAININGIV. MISCELLANEOUS PROJECTS SUPPORTING THE PROGRAMMATIC AGREEMENT AND HPP

TRIBAL MONITORING OF THE GRAND CANYON AND GLEN CANYON ENSURE THAT THE PRINCIPLES OF THE GRANDCANYON PROTECTION ACT ARE CARRIED OUT FOR THE PUBLIC GOOD. THE TRIBAL MONITORING PROGRAMPROVIDES VALUABLE INFORMATION ON THE HEALTH OF THESE CANYONS AND ENSURES THEIR PROTECTION FORFUTURE GENERATIONS. THE INPUT OF TRIBES DURING MEETINGS PROVIDES UNIQUE PERSPECTIVES BASED ONLONG AFFILIATION WITH THE CANYONS AND LEADS TO BETTER OUTCOMES PREDICATED ON TRIBAL-CENTRIC VALUES.I.PARTICIPATION.THE SCOPE OF WORK BELOW DESCRIBES THE ACTIVITIES THAT SHALL BE CARRIED OUT BY THE PUEBLO OF ZUNI AS AN ACTIVE AND ENGAGED STAKEHOLDER IN THE GLEN CANYON DAM ADAPTIVE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM. THE ACTIVITIES ARE DIVIDED INTO PARTICIPATION IN MEETINGS, PREPARATION FOR MEETINGS DOCUMENTS REVIEW, AND THE GENERATION OF WRITTEN COMMENTS WHEN NECESSARY. PARTICIPATION IN MEETINGS: ADAPTIVE MANAGEMENT WORK GROUP REPRESENTATIVE (OR AUTHORIZED ALTERNATE) OR TECHNICAL WORK GROUP REPRESENTATIVE (OR AUTHORIZED ALTERNATE), AS APPROPRIATE, WILL ATTEND AND ACTIVELY PARTICIPATE IN THE FOLLOWING MEETINGS:1.ADAPTIVE MANAGEMENT WORK GROUP MEETINGS (MINIMUM 2 PER YEAR).2.TECHNICAL WORK GROUP MEETINGS (MINIMUM 4 PER YEAR).3.BUDGET AD HOC (AS SCHEDULED).4.OTHER AMP AD HOC GROUP MEETINGS (AS SCHEDULED).5.PROGRAMMATIC AGREEMENT (PA) (AND HISTORIC PRESERVATION PLAN (HPP), AS SCHEDULED).6.DOCUMENTS REVIEW AND MEETING PREPARATION: THE GLEN CANYON DAM ADAPTIVE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM PRODUCES NUMEROUS DOCUMENTS WITHIN ANY GIVEN FISCAL YEAR THAT REQUIRE REVIEW AND COMMENT BY THE PARTICIPATING STAKEHOLDERS.7.GENERATION OF WRITTEN COMMENTS: IN ADDITION, PREPARATION FOR EACH MEETING OF THE GCDAMP SHALL OCCUR THROUGH THE REVIEW.8.MILESTONE: A DELIVERABLE FOR THE GCDAMP PARTICIPATION IS TO PRODUCE AN ANNUAL PERFORMANCE EVALUATION REPORT FOR ZUNI PARTICIPATION IN THE PROGRAM.II.MONITORING PROGRAM.HISTORIC PROPERTIES MONITORING: THE PRIMARY GOAL OF THIS ACTIVITY IS TO MONITOR AND EVALUATE THE EFFECTS (POSITIVE AND NEGATIVE) OF DAM OPERATIONS AND OTHER ACTIONS UNDER THE AUTHORITY OF THE SECRETARY OF THE INTERIOR ON HISTORIC PROPERTIES (INCLUDING PLACES OF ZUNI TRADITIONAL CULTURAL SIGNIFICANCE) TO NATIVE AMERICAN TRIBES. MILESTONE DELIVERABLES: ON AN ANNUAL BASIS, A REPORT DETAILING ZUNI ACTIVITIES ON EACH RIVER TRIP INCLUDING PROGRESS MADE TOWARD ACHIEVING THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE MONITORING PROGRAM WILL BE GENERATED. III.CULTURAL SENSITIVITY TRAINING.THIS PROJECT, IS TO MEANINGFULLY INCORPORATE ZUNI TRADITIONAL KNOWLEDGE EXPERTISE IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF A CULTURAL SENSITIVITY TRAINING FOCUSED AT GCDAMP FUNDED RESEARCHERS, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO ALL GCMRC PERSONNEL AND OTHER GCDAMP STAKEHOLDER REPRESENTATIVES. MILESTONE DELIVERABLES:  CONDUCT TWO MEETINGS WITH THE ZUNI CULTURAL RESOURCE ADVISORY TEAM AND ZUNI TRIBAL COUNCIL TO IDENTIFY HOW ZUNI WANTS TO PARTICIPATE IN THE DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF THE CULTURAL SENSITIVITY TRAINING. IV.MISCELLANEOUS PROJECTS SUPPORTING THE PA AND HPP THE PUEBLO OF ZUNI SHALL ACCOMPLISH THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL TASKS OVER THE COURSE OF THE AGREEMENT THAT ARE CONSISTENT WITH THE TRIENNIAL WORK PLAN. PROJECT D.6 COLLABORATIVE MITIGATION EFFORT BETWEEN GRAND CANYON NPS, PUEBLO OF ZUNI, AND SKYSHIP FILMS.

TRIBAL MONITORING OF THE GRAND CANYON AND GLEN CANYON ENSURE THAT THE PRINCIPLES OF THE GRAND CANYON PROTECTION ACT ARE CARRIED OUT FOR THE PUBLIC GOOD.THE SCOPE OF WORK BELOW DESCRIBES THE ACTIVITIES THAT SHALL BE CARRIED OUT BY THE TRIBE AS AN ACTIVE AND ENGAGED STAKEHOLDER IN THE GLEN CANYON DAM ADAPTIVE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM.1. ADAPTIVE MANAGEMENT WORK GROUP MEETINGS (MINIMUM 2 PER YEAR).2. TWG MEETINGS (MINIMUM 4 PER YEAR).3. BUDGET AD HOC (AS SCHEDULED).4. OTHER AMP AD HOC GROUP MEETINGS (AS SCHEDULED).5. PROGRAMMATIC AGREEMENT (AND HPP, AS SCHEDULED). AS A STAKEHOLDER THAT IS CONSULTED BY RECLAMATION REGARDING THEIR ACTIVITIES TOWARD HISTORIC PROPERTIES LOCATED WITHIN THE COLORADO RIVER CORRIDOR THAT ARE AFFECTED BY GLEN CANYON DAM OPERATIONS, THE TRIBE PROVIDES COMMENTS CONCERNING THE TREATMENT AND PRESERVATION OF ANCESTRAL ARCHAEOLOGICAL SITES AND PLACES OF TRADITIONAL CULTURAL IMPORTANCE.6. DOCUMENTS REVIEW AND MEETING PREPARATION: THE GLEN CANYON DAM ADAPTIVE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM PRODUCES NUMEROUS DOCUMENTS WITHIN ANY GIVEN FISCAL YEAR THAT REQUIRE REVIEW AND COMMENT BY THE PARTICIPATING STAKEHOLDERS.7. GENERATION OF WRITTEN COMMENTS: IN ADDITION, PREPARATION FOR EACH MEETING OF THE GCDAMP WILL OCCUR THROUGH THE REVIEW OF ALL DOCUMENTS POSTED FOR THE AMWG AND TWG MEETINGS.8. MILESTONE: A DELIVERABLE FOR THE GCDAMP PARTICIPATION IS TO PRODUCE AN ANNUAL PERFORMANCE EVALUATION REPORT FOR TRIBAL PARTICIPATION IN THE PROGRAM.II.MONITORING PROGRAM.HISTORIC PROPERTIES MONITORING: THE PRIMARY GOAL OF THIS ACTIVITY IS TO MONITOR AND EVALUATE THE EFFECTS OF DAM OPERATIONS AND OTHER ACTIONS UNDER THE AUTHORITY OF THE SECRETARY OF THE INTERIOR ON HISTORIC PROPERTIES TO NATIVE AMERICAN TRIBES.MILESTONE DELIVERABLES: ON AN ANNUAL BASIS, A REPORT DETAILING GRANTEE ACTIVITIES ON EACH RIVER TRIP AND WHETHER THE GOALS OF THE MONITORING PROGRAM HAVE BEEN ACCOMPLISHED.III.CULTURAL SENSITIVITY TRAINING.THIS PROJECT IS TO FUND TRIBAL EXPERTISE IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF A CULTURAL SENSITIVITY TRAINING GCDAMP FUNDED RESEARCHERS AND OTHER INTERESTED GCDAMP PARTICIPANTS. COMPLETION OF THIS PROJECT ALLOWS FOR COMPLIANCE WITH THE 2017 PA STIPULATION IV.A(9).THIS TRAINING WILL BE DEVELOPED AND THEN REVISED ON A RECURRING BASIS, AS NEEDED.MILESTONE DELIVERABLES:  DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT A CULTURAL SENSITIVITY TRAINING PROGRAM THAT WILL BE USED BY ALL RESEARCHERS WORKING WITHIN THE GCDAMP.IV.MISCELLANEOUS PROJECTS SUPPORTING THE PA AND HPP THE TRIBE PROPOSES TO ACCOMPLISH THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL TASKS OVER THE COURSE OF THE AGREEMENT THAT ARE CONSISTENT WITH THE TRIENNIAL WORK PLAN.D.8 - A PROPOSAL TO STUDY HUALAPAI AGRICULTURAL AND GARDENING PRACTICESMORE INFORMATION IS NEEDED TO STUDY HUALAPAI AGRICULTURE AND GARDENING IN RELATION TO THE GRAND CANYON.A FUNDED STUDY SHALL MAP OUT EXACT LOCATIONS AND POTENTIALLY ESTIMATE THE AMOUNT OF FOOD THAT MAY HAVE BEEN GROWN IN THESE AREAS BY THE HUALAPAI.D.11 SHARED HISTORIES ALONG THE COLORADO RIVER IN GRAND CANYONTHE PROJECT SHALL INVESTIGATE THE HUALAPAI PEOPLES SHARED RELATIONSHIPS AND HISTORIES WITH OTHER TRIBES THAT INHABITED THE COLORADO RIVER IN THE GRAND CANYON BELOW GLEN CANYON DAM.THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL CONSIST OF THE FOLLOWING WORK ACTIVITIES: SYNTHESIZE ARCHIVAL AND ETHNOHISTORIC MATERIALS CONCERNING THE HUALAPAI PEOPLES INTERACTIONS AND RELATIONSHIPS WITH NEIGHBORING TRIBES RE-EXAMINE EXISTING ARCHAEOLOGICAL SITE RECORDS AND OTHER EVIDENCE FOR CLUES TO INTER-TRIBAL HISTORIESINITIATE JOINT MEETINGS BETWEEN HUALAPAI AND OTHER PARTICIPANT TRIBAL MEMBERS TO DISCUSS CURRENT KNOWLEDGE ABOUT PAST SHARED HISTORIESWE SHALL UNDERTAKE THIS PROJECT OVER A THREE-YEAR PERIOD ENCOMPASSING THE FY2023  2026.DELIVERABLES FOR THE PROPOSED PROJECT SHALL INCLUDE DESCRIPTIVE REPORTS FOR EACH PARTICIPANT TRIBE, AS WELL AS A SYNTHETIC SUMMARY FOR USE BY THE GCDAMP FOR MANAGEMENT PURPOSES.
GLEN CANYON DAM ADAPTIVE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM  GCDAMP  - NAVAJO NATION PARTICIPATION AND MONITORING

THE COLLECTION IS STORED AT THE CENTER FOR ARCHAEOLOGICAL RESEARCH (CAR) AT THE UNIVERSITY OF TEXAS AT SAN ANTONIO (UTSA), TEXAS. THE PROJECT S GOAL IS TO CATALOG AND UPDATE MUSEUM BAGS HOLDING OBJECTS FROM RECLAMATION COLLECTIONS. THE GOAL IS ALSO TO CATALOG RECLAMATION S MUSEUM RECORDS CURRENTLY HOUSED IN REGULAR FILE CABINETS AND RELOCATE PHOTOGRAPHS AND ORIGINAL PAPERWORK TO FIREPROOF CABINETS.
MB CULTURAL RESOURCES
LONG-TERM CURATION OF RECLAMATION ARCHAEOLOGICAL COLLECTIONS

THE PRINCIPAL PURPOSE OF THIS AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR A PROJECT THAT ACHIEVES THE PUBLIC PURPOSE IDENTIFIED IN THE STATUTORY AUTHORITY.THE UTAH STATE HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICE (UTSHPO) MANAGES THE CURES DATABASE, A GEOGRAPHIC INFORMATION SYSTEMS (GIS) DATABASE OF ALL ARCHAEOLOGICAL DATA IN THE STATE OF UTAH AND MAKES THAT DATA AVAILABLE TO BOR CULTURAL RESOURCE MANAGERS. AS THE CENTRAL REPOSITORY FOR ALL ARCHAEOLOGICAL DATA IN THE STATE OF UTAH, THE UTSHPO MANAGES OVER 110,000 ARCHAEOLOGICAL SITE RECORDS, OVER 65,000 ARCHAEOLOGICAL REPORT RECORDS, AND A VARIETY OF MISCELLANEOUS PAPER AND DIGITAL FILES REGARDING COMPLIANCE WITH THE CULTURAL RESOURCES LAWS WITHIN THE STATE.STAFF AT THE UTSHPO CONTINUE TO MAINTAIN EXISTING PAPER AND DIGITAL RECORDS, WHILE PROCESSING THOUSANDS OF INCOMING RECORDS PER YEAR. WORKFLOWS AT UTSHPO INCLUDE DIGITIZING PAPER SITE AND REPORT RECORDS AND SERVING THEM OUT BACK THROUGH SEGO (A WEB-BASED CULTURAL RESOURCES VIEWER), AND CREATING/MAINTAINING/UPDATING GIS DATA THAT IS NOT CURRENTLY SERVED DIRECTLY TO THE BOR THROUGH THE CURES DATABASE.UNDER THIS NEW AGREEMENT, UTAH SHPO AGREES TO DO THE FOLLOWING EACH YEAR AND AS NEEDED:(1) MAINTAIN HISTORICAL AND ARCHAEOLOGICAL DATA BASES AND SHARE DATA CUTS FROM THOSE DATABASES WITH RECLAMATION ON A QUARTERLY OR SEMI-ANNUAL BASIS.(2) SHARE HISTORICAL AND ARCHEOLOGICAL INFORMATION WITH RECLAMATION, OTHER FEDERAL AND STATE AGENCIES, AND PRIVATE ORGANIZATIONS AND INDIVIDUALS INTERESTED IN HISTORIC PRESERVATION, AS APPROPRIATE.(3) ASSIST RECLAMATION IN GATHERING INFORMATION (I.E., CONDUCTING LITERATURE SEARCHES) REGARDING DOCUMENTED HISTORIC AND ARCHEOLOGICAL PROPERTIES. THIS INCLUDED PROVIDING COPIES OR SCANS OF SITE FORMS OR INVENTORY REPORTS, OR SHAPE FILES.(4) ENTER DATA PROVIDED BY RECLAMATION INTO THE STATEWIDE DATA BASES AND GIS SYSTEMS.

THE PRINCIPAL PURPOSE OF THIS AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR A PROJECT THAT ACHIEVES THE PUBLIC PURPOSE IDENTIFIED IN THE STATUTORY AUTHORITY THE NEW MEXICO SHPO AND THE BUREAU OF RECLAMATION  RECLAMATION  WILL WORK TOGETHER TO SUPPORT THE NATIONAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION ACT OF 1966  NHPA   UNDER THIS ACT, FEDERAL AGENCIES MAY PROVIDE FUNDING TO A STATE HISTORIC PROGRAM FOR THE MAINTENANCE OF HISTORICAL AND ARCHEOLOGICAL DATA BASES  SECTION 112 OF THE NHPA   THE NEW MEXICO SHPO MAINTAINS A STATEWIDE DATABASE OF CULTURAL, HISTORIC, AND PREHISTORIC RESEARCH  RECLAMATION DESIRES CONTINUED ACCESS TO THIS DATABASE AND WILL HAVE ITS OWN CULTURAL RESEARCH ADDED INTO THE EXISTING DATABASES TASKSUNDER THIS NEW AGREEMENT, NEW MEXICO SHPO AGREES TO DO THE FOLLOWING EACH YEAR AND AS NEEDED  1  MAINTAIN HISTORICAL AND ARCHAEOLOGICAL DATA BASES AND SHARE DATA CUTS FROM THOSE DATABASES WITH RECLAMATION ON A QUARTERLY OR SEMI ANNUAL BASIS  2  SHARE HISTORICAL AND ARCHEOLOGICAL INFORMATION WITH RECLAMATION, OTHER FEDERAL AND STATE AGENCIES, AND PRIVATE ORGANIZATIONS AND INDIVIDUALS INTERESTED IN HISTORIC PRESERVATION, AS APPROPRIATE  3  ASSIST RECLAMATION IN GATHERING INFORMATION  I E , CONDUCTING LITERATURE SEARCHES  REGARDING DOCUMENTED HISTORIC AND ARCHEOLOGICAL PROPERTIES  THIS INCLUDES PROVIDING COPIES OR SCANS OF SITE FORMS OR INVENTORY REPORTS, OR SHAPE FILES  4  ENTER DATA PROVIDED BY RECLAMATION INTO THE STATEWIDE DATA BASES AND GIS SYSTEMS

THE PRINCIPAL PURPOSE OF THIS AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR A PROJECT THAT ACHIEVES THE PUBLIC PURPOSE IDENTIFIED IN THE STATUTORY AUTHORITY.THE STATE HISTORICAL SOCIETY OF COLORADO AND THE BUREAU OF RECLAMATION (RECLAMATION) WILL WORK TOGETHER TO SUPPORT THE NATIONAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION ACT OF 1966 (NHPA). UNDER THIS ACT, FEDERAL AGENCIES MAY PROVIDE FUNDING TO A STATE HISTORIC PROGRAM FOR THE MAINTENANCE OF HISTORICAL AND ARCHEOLOGICAL DATA BASES (SECTION 112 OF THE NHPA). THE STATE HISTORICAL SOCIETY OF COLORADO'S OFFICE OF ARCHAEOLOGY AND HISTORIC PRESERVATION (OAHP) MAINTAINS A STATEWIDE DATABASE OF CULTURAL, HISTORIC, AND PREHISTORIC RESEARCH. RECLAMATION DESIRES CONTINUED ACCESS TO THIS DATABASE AND WILL HAVE ITS OWN CULTURAL RESEARCH ADDED INTO THE EXISTING DATABASES.UNDER THIS NEW AGREEMENT, THE STATE HISTORICAL SOCIETY OF COLORADO'S OAHP AGREES TO DO THE FOLLOWING EACH YEAR AND AS NEEDED:(1) MAINTAIN HISTORICAL AND ARCHAEOLOGICAL DATABASES AND SHARE DATA CUTS FROM THOSE DATABASES WITH RECLAMATION ON A QUARTERLY OR SEMI-ANNUAL BASIS.(2) SHARE HISTORICAL AND ARCHAEOLOGICAL INFORMATION WITH RECLAMATION, OTHER FEDERAL AND STATE AGENCIES, AND PRIVATE ORGANIZATIONS AND INDIVIDUALS INTERESTED IN HISTORIC PRESERVATION, AS APPROPRIATE.(3) ENTER DATA PROVIDED BY RECLAMATION INTO THE STATEWIDE DATA BASES AND GIS SYSTEMS.(4) ASSIST RECLAMATION IN GATHERING INFORMATION (I.E., CONDUCTING LITERATURE SEARCHES) REGARDING DOCUMENTED HISTORIC AND ARCHAEOLOGICAL PROPERTIES. THIS INCLUDES PROVIDING COPIES OR SCANS OF SITE FORMS OR INVENTORY REPORTS, GIS SHAPEFILES, AND ACCESS TO THE COMPASS DATABASE.(5) PASS-THROUGH FUNDS FROM RECLAMATION TO PALEOCULTURAL RESOURCE GROUP (PCRG) FOR THE IMPLEMENTATION AND PRODUCTION OF "HISTORY OF IRRIGATION IN THE WEST" REFERENCED IN THE PROGRAMMATIC AGREEMENT BETWEEN RECLAMATION, PCRG, AND OTHER ENTITIES.(6) PROCESS RECLAMATION'S ANNUAL STATE PERMIT APPLICATIONS FOR YEARS 2-5 OF THE COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT.
TEXAS ARCHEOLOGICAL RESEARCH LABORATORY LONG TERM CURATION

MB CULTURAL RESOURCES

THE BUREAU OF RECLAMATION, UPPER COLORADO BASIN PLANS TO ENTER INTO A
GRANT WITH MUSEUM OF NEW MEXICO INDIAN ARTS AND CULTURES (MIAC) FOR
LONG-TERM CURATION OF ARCHAEOLOGICAL COLLECTIONS RECOVERED AS A RESULT OF
CONGRESS' DECISION TO BUILD AND OPERATE NAVAJO RESERVOIR AND DAM, AS
PART OF THE COLORADO RIVER STORAGE PROJECT. THE COLLECTIONS WERE
GENERATED AS MITIGATION FOR THE EXISTENCE OF THE DAM AND WATER STORAGE
PROJECT.

NATIONAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION ACT OF 1966 (AS AMENDED, P.L. 89-665, 54 U.S.C) MANDATES THAT THE STATE HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICER (SHPO) CONDUCT A STATEWIDE SURVEY OF HISTORIC PROPERTIES AND MAINTAIN AN INVENTORY OF SUCH PROPERTIES IN COOPERATION WITH FEDERAL AGENCIES. 54 U.S.C. MANDATES THAT THE SHPO MAINTAINS HISTORICAL AND ARCHAEOLOGICAL DATABASES AND ALLOWS INTERIOR BUREAUS TO ENTER INTO CONTRACTS OR COOPERATIVE AGREEMENTS FOR PURPOSES OF MAINTAINING HISTORIC AND ARCHEOLOGICAL DATABASES. THE MAJOR OBJECTIVES/ACTIVITIES BY THE STATE OF WYOMING WILL BE TO: 1) ADD ALL SUBMITTED DATA TO THE DATABASE AND MAINTAIN THE DATABASE OF ARCHEOLOGICAL RECORDS. 2) CONDUCT MAINTENANCE OF HISTORICAL AND ARCHAEOLOGICAL DATA BASES. 3) SHARE INFORMATION WITH RECLAMATION AND OTHERS AS DESCRIBED IN THE NATIONAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION ACT.
